message.content:
cs.HC, cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.DL 

The paper presents an approach for visual analytics of high-volume text streams, which involves identifying representative topics and aligning them with existing topics to understand hierarchical topic evolution. This involves developing a dynamic Bayesian network model to derive tree cuts in incoming topic trees and connecting corresponding topics at different times. The paper focuses on the development of a sedimentation-based visualization to enable interactive analysis of streaming text data. Given the focus on visual analytics and text analysis, the most likely sub-category is cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction). Other likely sub-categories include cs.IR (Information Retrieval), cs.CL (Computation and Language), cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), and cs.DL (Machine Learning).
